title: Year dropdown
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads player page
custom_steps:
WHEN 
1. user views the player page and Search by Roster module
2. user clicks year dropdown
custom_expected:
THEN 
1. Make sure 'Year' Search by Roster dropdown appears
2. Make sure clicking a year within the dropdown appropriately matches the Team and Player dropdowns

title: Team dropdown - https://statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1/teams?sportId=1&leagueListId=mlb_hist&season=2018
custom_preconds: GIVEN user selects the Team dropdown
custom_steps:
WHEN user selects the Team dropdown 
and clicks on a team
custom_expected:
THEN 
1. the data within 'Team' dropdown should correlate and match the Year dropdown and Results in Player dropdown. 
2. clicking on a team name should affect the Player dropdown

Example check to make sure if user changes year, team and player dropdown will update

title: Player dropdown - https://statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1/teams/117/roster?hydrate=person&season=2018&rosterType=40Man
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads player page and user has already selected Year and Team dropdowns
custom_steps: WHEN user selects the Player dropdown
custom_expected:
THEN - 
1. dropdown results should match the Year and Team dropdowns and show the 40-man roster of the Team selected
2. clicking Player should link to selected player page

title: Search bar - check accents, tildes, jrs, initials, traded players, etc.
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads page on web browser
custom_steps: WHEN user types in letters to Search bar
custom_expected:
THEN 
1. search should populate based on entered text
2. user should be able to click on and link to player page
3. player headshot should be available 

Edge Cases: 
Ronald Acuna Jr.
Travis d'Arnaud
Jacob deGrom
Eduardo Nunez
J.D. Martinez

title: Sub-Nav sections and linkage
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads player page on mobile or web browser
custom_steps: WHEN user views page or clicks on sub-navigation (sub-nav)
custom_expected:
THEN
1. sub-nav section headers should appear (when data is available) - Summary, Stats, Charts, News, Fantasy, Awards, SHOP
2. clicking on section header should direct user to that selected section on player page

title: Sub nav should stick to top of page when scrolling down page
custom_preconds: GIVEN user views player page on mobile device or web browser
custom_steps: WHEN user scrolls down the page
custom_expected: THEN the sub-nav should stick to the top of the page when scrolling to bottom

title: Sticky subnav should contain above sections w/name, number, position
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads page and scrolls down past action shot
custom_steps: WHEN user scrolls down player page past the action shot
custom_expected:
THEN 
1. In XL, L viewports - the sticky Nav should show Player's first & last name, jersey number, team logo, and Position abbrv. on the left side of sticky nav
2. IN M, S, XS viewports - the sticky Nav should only show section titles

title: Sub-Nav fits below action shot
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads player page on mobile device or web browser
custom_steps: WHEN user views page
custom_expected: THEN the sub-nav should be placed below the action shot

title: Current Player head shot and action shot appear on player page
custom_preconds: GIVEN user Current Player has a Headshot and Action shot
custom_steps: WHEN user loads page of a Current Player with Headshot and Action shot
custom_expected:
THEN player headshot and action shot should appear and match the API call

Use this Stats API - http://statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1/people/457763

title: Players without headshot
custom_preconds: GIVEN player does not have a headshot image
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing player without headshot
custom_expected: THEN player bio information should be left aligned on page

title: Players without action shot
custom_preconds: GIVEN player does not have action shot
custom_steps: WHEN player does not have action shot
custom_expected:
THEN IF 
player is played at or after 1965 show "baseball balls" - https://securea.mlb.com/images/players/action_shots/mlb_default_contemporary.jpg
player is played at or before 1964 show "old glove"- https://securea.mlb.com/images/players/action_shots/mlb_default_historic.jpg

title: MLBPA logo shows in bottom right corner
custom_preconds: GIVEN player is active
custom_steps: WHEN player is active and user views player page
custom_expected: THEN the MLBPA image logo should appear in bottom right corner of action shot

title: Check Pitcher's Quick Stats section
custom_steps: WHEN looking at Pitcher's player page
custom_expected: THEN Quick Stats should show Pitcher's Current Season and Career PITCHING quick stats

title: Check Hitter's Quick Stats section
custom_steps: WHEN looking at Hitter's player page
custom_expected: THEN Quick Stats should show Hitter's Current Season and Career Hitting quick stats

title: Check Shohei Ohtani (660271) edge case
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is looking at a 2 way player (Hitter and Pitcher)
custom_steps: WHEN user views Shohei Ohtani player page
custom_expected: THEN user should see Ohtani's PITCHING quick stats

title: Check player traded midseason
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is viewing a player traded mid-season
custom_steps: WHEN a user views a player that was traded mid-season
custom_expected: THEN user should see the player's combined quick stats for his current and former team

title: Player Status info
custom_preconds: GIVEN Player Status info shows underneath Quick Stats section
custom_steps: WHEN user views Player's Status info
custom_expected: THEN it should pull info from API and show either Active, 30 Day DL, 60 Day DL, etc.

title: Next Game info
custom_preconds: GIVEN Next Game info should appear below the Quick Stats section
custom_steps: WHEN user views Next Game info
custom_expected: THEN Next Game info should be pulled in from the API with the next game player would be playing (vs.BOS 6/20)

title: Config can be turned on to show Postseason Stats
custom_preconds: GIVEN Product Owner turns on Postseason config to show Postseason Quick Stats
custom_steps: WHEN Product Owner turns on the Postseason config to show PS stats
custom_expected:
THEN 
Postseason Stats AND Postseason Career Stats should appear in the Quick Stats section

title: Player Details - Name, Number, Position, Bat/Throw, Height/Weight, Age
custom_steps: WHEN loading a player's page
custom_expected:
THEN the Player Vitals should show 
1. NAME
2. NUMBER
3. POSTION
4. BAT/THROW
5. HEIGHT/WEIGHT
6. AGE

title: Bio under headshot - Full Name, Nickname, DOB - Place, Draft, College, Debut, ETC.
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a player's bio on player page
custom_expected:
THEN player bio should contain
1. FULL NAME
2. NICKNAME
3. DOB - PLACE
4. DRAFT
5. COLLEGE/SCHOOL
6. DEBUT
7. HALL OF FAME DATE
8. DEATH DATE
9. RELATIONSHIP(S)

title: Social Follows - Twitter player/club
custom_preconds: GIVEN player and/or league has mlb twitter accounts
custom_steps:
WHEN 
1. user loads player page
2. clicks on Twitter (Social) buttons
custom_expected:
THEN
1. user sees the league (mlb) and or player twitter social buttons
2. user is able to click the twitter buttons (link out to a separate module)

title: View More Bio includes pop up modal
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads player page with View More Bio modal
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on the "View More Bio Info" button
custom_expected: THEN a modal pops up to give more information about player

title: Check Shohei Ohtani (660271) edge case
custom_preconds: GIVEN Shohei Ohtani is chosen (2 way player)
custom_steps: WHEN user loads Shohei Ohtani's page
custom_expected: THEN Ohtani's primary position is pitcher, so P will show as position

title: Player Splits should appear in 2 columns
custom_steps: WHEN user views Splits Section on Player Page
custom_expected:
THEN Splits section should appear in 2 columns
Column 1 (left) = Last X Games
Column 2 (right) = Last 3 Games

title: Column 1 - Line 1: Last 7, Line 2: Last 15, Line 3: Last 30
custom_steps: WHEN user views the Last "X" Games column
custom_expected:
THEN section should show three lines 
IF player did not play "X" amount of games, lines should still show but include dashes (-)
Batter: AB, R, H, HR, RBI, BB, SO, SB, AVG, OBP, SLG
Pitcher: W, L, ERA, G, GS, SV, IP, H, ER, BB, SO, WHIP
1. Last 7 Games
2. Last 15 Games
3. Last 30 Games

title: Column 2 - Shows last 3 games on separate lines
custom_steps: WHEN user views Last 3 Games - Splits column
custom_expected:
THEN Last 3 individual games should appear on 3 separate lines
Batter: AB, R, H, HR, RBI, BB, SO, SB
Pitcher: W, L, SV, IP, H, ER, BB, SO
1. most recent game (6/25)
2. next most recent game (6/24)
3. third most recent (6/23)

title: Check Shohei Ohtani (660271) edge case
custom_steps: WHEN user views Shoehei Ohtani page
custom_expected: THEN he is viewed as a Pitcher so he shows his Pitcher's Splits

title: Confirm line with Games by Position under module
custom_steps: WHEN user views the Games by Position feature underneath the Splits section
custom_expected:
THEN Games by Position should show all of the Positions the player has played
IF Player was traded mid-year - data should be combined and should show the same position more than once

title: Check player who has been traded midseason
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a player who has been traded mid-season
custom_expected: THEN splits should show stats for both teams and use API data

title: Match player with API statcast averages
custom_steps: WHEN user views the Statcast section
custom_expected: THEN the stats and data should match the API call from above

Load images (3 in web, 4 in mobile viewports)
